result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Purge condition of $150.00 paid.
Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker not in court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Melissa Marie Crocker.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. Court: Def was not at the last hearing and rescheduled today. Atty Helgeson: called his office yesterday but no contact with Defendant. ADA Schieffer requests a warrant with a $25 bond. Court authorizes a statewide warrant with a $150 bond.

10:03 AM Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker not in court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Melissa Marie Crocker.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Helgeson: Def called his office and is sick. ADA Schieffer agrees to reschedule the plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:43 PM Melissa Marie Crocker appears in Court,  Atty Philip A. Helgeson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Schieffer states the matter is resolved,restitution to be paid up front. Court will reset the plea hearing. Court confirms address. Court adjourned at 1:47 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

04:07 PM Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker in Court with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of charge and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Atty. Helgeson enters NG plea.  Bond continues.  Court confirms address and phone.  Adjourned at 4:10 PM

04:00 PM Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker in Court with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  S/T Ellsworth PD Officer Darrin Foss.  Direct by ADA Schieffer.  4:04 PM  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Helgeson.  No redirect.  State requests bindover.  No argument by Atty. Helgeson.  Court makes findings; finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:41 AM Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS, no objection. Court so orders. Prelim demanded. Court adjourned at 9:45 am.
